data.text:
I am not sure whether it has something to do with my locale settings, which are hopefully fine, or fonts.

locale -a C en_US.utf8 POSIX ru_RU.utf8 uk_UA.utf8

When I switch between keyboard layouts I can type, say in libreoffice or firefox on any language, i.e. ua,ru,en. However, when I type in the terminal, if the language is ru or ua, not one symbol is typed in, nothing is typed in. Again, if I ls files in directory, ua and ru letters are not displayed, en are. Unicode is also not displayed. Fonts issue?

I use Arch with Suckless Terminal, however this issue applies to dmenu and to xterm too.

Solved. https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Locale#Setting_the_system_locale

It just happens that I had not configured system locale. I checked the output of locale command - LANG='C', then, according to the wiki:

localectl set-locale LANG=en_US.UTF-8

logged out and logged in (restarted the session)

Read the wiki for more detail.
